intro: Fuirena haemaglottis, commonly known as the red globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, bright red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, soft hairs. Fuirena haemaglottis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to arid landscapes.
